notes.text: Impedance is a specialized electrical term (as defined above), while impediment is an everyday term meaning 'a hindrance or obstruction': a low-impedance power supply; interpreting his handwriting was an impediment to getting business done

definitions: the effective resistance of an electric circuit or component to alternating current, arising from the combined effects of ohmic resistance and reactance.

notes.text: Impedance is usually expressed as a complex quantity Z = R + jX, where R is resistance, X is reactance, and j is the imaginary square root of −1

shortDefinitions: effective resistance of electric circuit or component to alternating current, arising from combined effects of ohmic resistance and reactance
